name: Grandma's Italian Easter Bread
summary: Other recipes include adding in mixed candied fruits or chopped almonds.
author: Rose Barbano
instructions: Mix well - flour, salt anise seed, baking powder, sugar and lemon rind.
Beat together eggs.
Dissolve yeast in water and add 1 tsp. Sugar to yeast.
Add anise extract and margarine (after it cools) to eggs.
Add dissolved yeast.
Mix well.
Make a hole in the middle of the flour mixture and add egg mixture to it.
Mix well.
Turn onto board or table drizzled with flour and knead for about 10 minutes.
Grease pot or large bowl and place dough inside to let rise.
Place a towel over the pot or bowl and place in warm spot away from drafts. (I put it in the oven or you could put it in a sunny room).
Dough should double in size â€“ a couple of hours.
Remove from pot or bowl and knead for just a few minutes to remove bubbles.
Place dough in bread pans or shape into round loaves and let rise a second time.
Sometimes while I'm kneading the second time I turn the oven on low and them turn it off before I put the loaves in the oven to rise a second time.
Bake at 350 for about 35 minutes.
Half way through brush a beaten egg on top of the loaves. This makes them shiny.

name: Mom's Zucchini Bread
summary: When we were young, we used to grow huge, huge zucchini in our back yard agrden and didnt know what to do with them.  My mom has been making this ever since.
author: Delores Whaley
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a large bowl
Grease 2 bread pans
Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees

name: Hummus with Tahini
ingredients: 2 - 16 oz can of chickpeas or garbanzo beans
1/4 cup liquid from can of chickpeas
1/8 cup tablespoons lemon juice (depending on taste)
1 1/2 tablespoons tahini sesame paste, found in both dairy and dry specialty foods sections
instructions: Drain chickpeas and set aside liquid from can.
Combine remaining ingredients in blender or food processor.
Add 1/4 cup of liquid from chickpeas.
Blend for 3-5 minutes on low until thoroughly mixed and smooth.
Place in serving bowl, and create a shallow well in the center of the hummus.
Add a small amount (1-2 tablespoons) of olive oil in the well. Garnish with parsley (optional).
Serve immediately with fresh, warm or toasted pita bread, or cover and refrigerate.
Make sure your container is sealed well, or your fridge will smell like garlic!
Hummus can be refrigerated for up to 3 days and can be kept in the freezer for up to one month.
Add a little olive oil if it appears to be too dry.

name: Mary Ann's Sweet & Spicy Meatballs
author: Mary Ann Sarao
instructions: In a large bowl, mix ground beef, parsley, and onion powder with your hands.
Shape the ground beef mix into meatballs approximately 1 inch in diameter.
Place the meatballs into a serving dish
Pan fry the meatballs. Do this in batches if necessary.
Mix the jelly, chili sauce, mustard, soy sauce, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger in a small sauce pan
Heat the sauce ingredients on medium-high heat until all the jelly is melted.
Pour the sauce over the meatballs and mix until they are all covered thoroughly.
Serve warm

name: Alton Brown's Chicken Fried Steak
author: Alton Brown
ingredients: 2 pounds beef bottom round, trimmed of excess fat
instructions: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
Cut the meat with the grain into 1/2-inch thick slices.
Season each piece on both sides with the salt and pepper.
Place the flour into a pie pan.
Place the eggs into a separate pie pan.
Dredge the meat on both sides in the flour.
Tenderize the meat, using a needling device, until each slice is 1/4-inch thick.
Once tenderized, dredge the meat again in the flour, followed by the egg and finally in the flour again.
Repeat with all the pieces of meat.
Place the meat onto a plate and allow it to sit for 10 to 15 minutes before cooking.
Place enough of the vegetable oil to cover the bottom of a 12-inch slope-sided skillet and set over medium-high heat.
Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the meat in batches, being careful not to overcrowd the pan.
Cook each piece on both sides until golden brown, approximately 4 minutes per side.
Remove the steaks to a wire rack set in a half sheet pan and place into the oven.
Repeat until all of the meat is browned.
Add the remaining vegetable oil, or at least 1 tablespoon, to the pan.
Whisk in 3 tablespoons of the flour left over from the dredging.
Add the chicken broth and deglaze the pan. Whisk until the gravy comes to a boil and begins to thicken.
Add the milk and thyme and whisk until the gravy coats the back of a spoon, approximately 5 to 10 minutes.
Season to taste, with more salt and pepper, if needed.
Serve the gravy over the steaks.

name: Beef Stroganoff
summary: According to Wikipedia, Beef Stroganoff was invented by a chef working for a Russian general, Count Pavel Stroganov, in the 1890s. It became popular in the U.S. in the 1950s from servicemen returning from Europe and China after WWII. Beef Stroganoff is basically tender strips of beef and mushrooms cooked in a sour cream sauce and served over noodles, rice, or even French fries. You will want to make this with a tender cut of beef, such as tenderloin or top sirloin. For a quick version you can use ground beef instead of beef strips. You can also easily substitute yogurt for sour cream and leave out the mushrooms entirely.
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 2 pounds top lean sirloin roast, trimmed
3 tablespoons low fat sour cream, room temperature
instructions: Cut the sirloin into narrow 2-inch long strips about 1/4 inch thick
Sprinkle the meat with salt and pepper to your taste
Heat 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium saucepan
Blend in 1 tablespoon flour
Gradually stir in beef broth, stirring and cooking until thickened and smooth
Dice the onion and the mushrooms
Heat 1 tablespoon of butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a separate small saucepan over medium heat
Quickly brown mushrooms and onions
If using nutmeg and/or tarragon, add those here
Add the mushrooms and onions to the beef sauce
Heat another 1 tablespoon of butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat
Quickly brown meat strips on all sides. You may need to do this in batches.
Add the browned meat to beef sauce
Cover and cook on low for 20 minutes
While the beef is cooking, put on a pot of boiling water.
Once the water comes to a boil, add the bag of egg noodles. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes
When there are only 2 to 3 minutes left for the egg noodles, stir in sour cream to the beef and sauce at a low heat
Serve the beef and the sauce over the egg noodles

name: Black Bean Soup
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups boneless skinless white-meat chicken, ham, or sausage, chopped into bite size pieces
2 15-ounce cans reduced sodium black beans, rinsed and drained or 1 bag dried black beans
5 slices bacon (remove this if you want a lower-fat soup)
instructions: Boil black beans for 60 to 90 minutes, or as instructed on the package of black beans
Chop carrots, celery, onion, and chicken
Drain beans
Chop bacon into fine pieces
Add the bacon andfry it in the bottom of large soup pot for 3 to 5 minutes.
Add in onions, carrots, peppers, and chicken and sautee for 5 minutes.
Stir in cumin, chili powder, thyme, oregano,cilantro,garlic, black pepper, and cook for 1 minute.
Blend roughly one third of the black beans in a food processor and add to the pot
Add the rest of the black beans, broth, and bay leaf
Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
In another pot, cook one cup rice as instructed on package
Serve soup over rice with sour cream and cheddar on top as garnish

name: Brian's Fried Shrimp Parmesan
summary: You just don't see Fried Shrimp Parmesan.  So I decided to try it myself. It takes a long time to make, but it's worth it.
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 1 bag (2 pounds) frozen, peeled, deveined shrimp
instructions: Defrost shrimp in a collander under cold running water
Be sure all the shrimp are peeled and deveined
Be sure all theshrimp also have their tails removed
Preheat oil in a frying pan on medium-high heat
Mix the eggs and milk into a bowl
Place the bread crumbs into a second bowl
Dip each shrimp into the milk and eggs, then into the bread crumbs
Fry each shrimp for 3 to 5 minutes, until golden brown
Set shrimp aside on a plate covered in paper towels, to drain away the excess oil
Once all shrimp are fried, cover the bottom of a pyrex dish with the shrimp
Cover the shrimp with the Italian tomato sauce
Sprinkle with garlic powder, black pepper, oregano, basil, and parsley to taste
Cover with mozarella cheese
If there is still shrimp left over, you can do another layer of shrimp, sauce, and cheese
Bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until cheese around the edges begins to brown

name: Brian's Kielbasa and Potatoes
summary: When I was in Munich, Germany, I found a dish just like this being served in a bier garden. They were making this by the cauldron-ful. The food was fantastic, the atmosphere was great, and I had a wonderful time.
author: Brian T. Whaley
instructions: In a large frying pan, heat the olive oil
Dice the onion and add to the frying pan at high heat
Quarter the kielbasa lengthwise, and dice into small pieces
Once the onion pieces are translucent, add in the kielbasa
Peel and dice the potatoes, and then add to the frying pan
Cover and place at medium heat for 15 minutes, mixing every 3 to 5 minutes
Dice the bell pepper and add to the frying pan
Add black pepper to taste
Place at high heat and mix every 3 to 5 minutes.
Stop when the potatoes begin to fall apart, and the kielbasa and potatoes are browned (approx 20 minutes)

name: Brian's Lemon Garlic Chicken
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 2 packages (approx. 10 pieces) boneless skinless chicken thighs
instructions: Add oil to a large sauce pan
Once hot, add garlic and lemon zest and juice
After 1 to 2 minutes, add chicken thighs, opened, to the pan
Add chicken broth
Sprinkle lemon pepper, basil, thyme, black pepper, and salt to taste
Let cook for 20 minutes
Add corn starch to 1/8 cup water
Add corn starch to the pan
Serve over rice

name: Cashew Chicken
summary: A Chinese-American dish that is growing in popularity is Cashew Chicken. This dish actually originated in the United States in Springfield, Missouri. Cashew Chicken can be found at many Chinese buffets across the country. This recipe for Cashew chicken consists of fried chicken bits with cashews and vegetables in a delicious oyster sauce. This recipe differs from others and those at the buffets because the chicken is breaded and then deep fried leaving the chicken pieces nice and crispy. The vegetables I added were green peppers, onions and scallions, but you could also add some sliced mushrooms as well if you want. Cashew Chicken is best served on top of white rice.  For a Bariatric-friendly version of this recipe, do not coat and fry the chicken - just cut into cubes or strips.  http://blogchef.net/cashew-chicken-recipe/
author: BlogChef
ingredients: 2lbs boneless skinless chicken breasts (cut into 1 inch chunks)
instructions: In a bowl mix flour, baking soda and 1 teaspoon of corn starch.
In another bowl beat the eggs.
Dip chicken pieces first then the flour mixture, then in the egg mixture and then again in the flour mixture.
Fry in oil in a wok or in a deep fryer at 350 degrees in batches until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels.
Heat a tiny bit of oil in the wok and stir fry green pepper and onions for 2-3 minutes.
Remove from wok and set aside.
To make the sauce- in a bowl mix chicken broth, oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, pepper, and 4 tablespoons of cornstarch.
Pour sauce into wok and cook over medium heat stirring until well blended and sauce thickens.
In a bowl pour sauce over chicken pieces, add green peppers and onions.
Mix well and garnish with cashews and green onions.
Serve with white rice.

name: Chicken Kielbasa Gumbo
summary: This recipe is very flexible. It is a great way to recycle leftover chicken meals. Some versions of this recipe also like to use the more flavorful chicken thighs instead of the chicken breasts. You can make it more or less spicy by adjusting the amount of chili powder and black pepper. And some versions of this recipe call for okra or diced tomatoes.
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 2 pounds chicken (both white and dark meat)
instructions: In a large pot, add the olive oil
Once hot, add the onions and sautÃ© until translucent
Add in the water and broth. Bring to a boil
Dice chicken and add to the broth
Add all of the remaining ingredients
Simmer until vegetables are tender, about 1 hour.
Thicken broth with a smooth paste made from 3 tablespoons cold water mixed with the cornstarch or flour.
Remove bay leaf before serving
Serve with hot cornbread, rice, or egg noodles.

name: Chicken Quesadillas
author: Bran T. Whaley
ingredients: (can also use ground beef, ground chicken,beef strips, or chicken strips)
2 packages (16 oz) grated low fat cheese
1 small container fat free sour cream
instructions: Dice the onion and set aside
Dice the bell pepper and set aside
Dice the olives and set aside
De-bone the chicken, dice all the removed chicken, and set aside
Heat a large skillet at medium-high heat
Take a very small pat of butter and melt it in the skillet
Place one burrito wrap in the melted butter
Add cheese to one half of the burrito
Add chicken, onion, bell pepper, olives, and salsa on top of the cheese
Add cheese on top of all the ingredients and fold the burrito in half
Let all this cook 2 to 3 minutes or until the burrito is golden brown on the bottom
Flip over to finish melting the cheese and brown the other side of the burrito
Remove when both sides are golden brown
Repeat steps 7 through 12 for approximately 6 quesadillas

name: Chicken Marsala
author: AllRecipes
ingredients: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded 1/4 inch thick
instructions: In a shallow dish or bowl, mix together the flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cayenne, thyme, paprika and oregano.
Coat chicken pieces in flour mixture.
In a large skillet, melt butter in oil over medium heat. Place chicken in the pan, and lightly brown.
Turn over chicken pieces, and add mushrooms.
Pour in wine and sherry.
Cover skillet
Simmer chicken 10 minutes, turning once, until no longer pink and juices run clear.

name: Grandma's Cappellettis
summary: The word cappelletto means little hat, or Pope's hat, which is what this pasta should resemble; they're from Modena. They are traditionally served in broth, as are their cousins, tortellini (the difference lies in the stuffing). Indeed, the traditional North Italian Christmas dinner starts with cappelletti in capon broth.  More information is available at http://italianfood.about.com/od/stuffedpasta/r/blr0102a.htm
author: Rose Barbano
instructions: Mix dough ingredients to make a medium soft dough comfortable to roll out. Add more flour or water as needed.
Thaw spinach, cool and squeeze out all of the water before mixing with meat.
Mix all ingredients
Roll out dough and cut into squares.
Fill with meat and fold like a triangle and then end to end.
Freeze on a cookie sheet.
After frozen, the cappellettis can be placed in zip lock bags for use whenever.
You should use ground beef that has not been frozen yet so that you could freeze the cappellettis after they are made.
Prepare chicken soup or serve with spaghetti sauce. Really good either way.

name: Grandma's Pizza Gaine
summary: This has been a family tradition at Easter ever since I can remember. The dish is sometimes known as Pizza Rustica, filled pizza, or meat pie. It is similar to a modern day quiche but much more dense and flavorful. Tradition says to make it on Good Friday and serve on Sunday when you can have meat again. Served in small quantities it is a wonderful addition to Easter brunch or an appetizer to a big Easter feast.  More information at http://www.tastebook.com/recipes/628567-Easter-Pizza-Gaine
author: Rose Barbano
ingredients: 1lb Canned ham (you can also make this with a wide variety of Italian meats - sausage, pepperoni, salami, prosciutto, etc)
instructions: Filling:
Boil ham and cut into pieces
Cut up cheese the same way
Grate macaroni cheese
Add black pepper
Add enough egg to loosen mixture
Add ricotta cheese
Crust:
Use regular boxed pie crust mix.
Top should be a crisscross design or use the form that you press on the top crust and it puts holes in it. The top crust should not be solid.
Bake at 350 for about 30 to 40 minutes.

name: Grandma's Porkette Sandwiches
author: Rose Barbano
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees
Try to trim away as much excess fat from around the pork loin as possible.
Cut three to four large slits across the pork loin. This will help it cook faster, and get more spice on the surface.
Sprinkle garlic, dill, black pepper, and salt on the pork loin
Cook the pork loin for 4 hours
Check in on the pork loin every half hour. Make sure the bottom is not burning. Add a cup of water to the bottom as necessary.
Let the pork loin cool to the touch
Pull the pork apart. Two forks makes this very easy
Cover in garlic, dill, black pepper, and salt.
Be careful with the black pepper and salt, and go heavy with the dill.

name: Laurent's Chicken Dijon Creme Fraiche
author: Laurent Bellan
ingredients: (you can also try 1 small diced onion and /or 1.5 cups diced mushrooms)
instructions: Put the rice on to cook
In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat
Open the chicken thighs and lay them in the pan
Sprinkle the Salt and Black pepper to taste
Let the chicken cook for 7 to 8 minutes
Turn over the chicken, and add more salt and pepper to taste
(if you use the onion and/or mushrooms, add them here)
Let the chicken cook for another 7 to 8 minutes
Platter the chicken and the rice
Add the sauce in the bottom of the pan to a gravy boat for serving

name: Mary Ann's Curry Chicken Salad
author: Mary Ann Sarao
instructions: Strip all the chicken meat from the bones. Do not use the skin.
Dice the chicken and place into a large bowl
Chop the diced carrots into smaller pieces. Add to the chicken
Dice the celery into very small pieces. Add to the bowl
Add the mayonnaise to the chicken salad
Sprinkle the curry and black pepper over the mayonnaise
Mix everything together
Make sure that there is enough mayonnaise to make the chicken moist and clump together
Make sure that there is enough curry to taste, but not too much to be overwhelming

name: Mom's Spaghetti Sauce and Meatballs
summary: My mom has been making this since I can remember.  She started early Sunday morning, and it cooked all day long.  What is always incredible to me is that the leftovers were always better on the seond day.
author: Delores Whaley
yield: 4 meals worth of sauce and meat
ingredients: 3 pounds ground meatloaf meat (pork, veal, beef)
3 slices white bread (or 1 cup bread crumbs)
instructions: Take 1 pound ground meat and brown in the bottom of a large cauldron
Add in cube beef stew
Add garlic, black pepper, basil and parsley
Let all the meat brown for a few minutes
Add in the cans of tomato sauce
Dice the red onion and add to the sauce
Let the sauce simmer while you make the meatballs
In a large bowl mix the remaining ground meat and the eggs
Add in garlic, black pepper, basil and parsley
Cube the bread slices into 1/2 inch cubes
Add the bread cubes to the meat
Squish with your hands until all ingredients are mixed
Form the meat mix into golf ball sized meatballs
Add olive oil to a frying pan
Place the meatballs into the frying pan
Fry until meatballs are brown and firm
Add the meatballs and any residual into the sauce
Simmer all afternoon (4 to 6 hours) with the lid on

name: Pita Pizza
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 1 (4 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained
instructions: Thin crusts can be made by cutting a pita in half horizontally.
Thick crusts can be made by not cutting the pita open.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F
Brown ground beef.
Warm pitas in the preheated oven or in a microwave for 1 minute, or until soft.
Spread 1 to 2 tablespoons tomato sauce on pita bread.
Top with hamburger, cheese, or any other toppings you may want
Place pizzas on lightly greased cookie sheet Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes until cheese is melted.

name: Sam Cohen's New Years Chili
author: Sam Cohen
ingredients: 2 pound ground beef, turkey or meatloaf mix (beef, pork, veal)
instructions: Place the oil in a large pot.
Cook ground meat and beef cubes in the large pot over medium-high heat until the meat is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink.
Stir in the chopped onions and the green pepper until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add in the dry spices, garlic, and fennel seeds and stir.
Stir in the worchestershire sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add in the beans, tomatoes, and paste, and mix thoroughly.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce heat to medium-low.
Simmer at least 2 hours, stirring every 15 minutes.
If possible, refrigerate overnight to let the flavors soak in. Reheat the chili over medium heat until it begins to simmer again.
Top individual servings of chili with cheese, sour cream, hot sauce, or chopped onions.

name: Slow Cooker Barbecue Ribs
author: Brian Whaley
ingredients: 2 containers of your favorite barbecue sauce
instructions: Cut each of the racks of ribs in half, to help them fit into the slow cooker.
Cover the top and bottom of each of the racks of ribs in barbecue sauce.
As you lay eachpiece in, sprinkle the top with the spices.
Drizzle the vinegar, cooking wine, worchestershire sauce, buffalo sauce, over the stack of ribs
Cover and cook on LOW, and cook 8 hours.

name: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
author: AllRecipes
instructions: Place beef stew meat into a slow cooker.
In a small bowl, mix together flour, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Sprinkle over beef stew meat, stirring to coat.
Stir in beef broth, teriyaki sauce, onion, carrots, celery, potatoes, mushrooms, garlic and bay leaf.
Cover, and cook on Low 6 hours, stirring occasionally.

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Thighs
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 1 medium onion, halved lengthwise and sliced
4 medium-size new potatoes (about 1 pound), cut into 1 inch cubes
2 cups baby carrots, cut into one inch pieces
instructions: Place onion in a 6-qt. slow cooker.
Top with potatoes and carrots.
Combine broth, white wine, minced garlic, lemon juice, thyme, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Pour broth mixture over vegetables.
Combine paprika, remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper; rub evenly over chicken thighs.
Arrange chicken on top of vegetables.
Cover and cook on LOW, and cook 6 hours or until chicken is done and vegetables are tender.
Special Crock Pot Chicken Instructions:
Remember that boneless, skinless chicken breasts can overcook in the crockpot. Make sure that these cuts don't cook longer than 6-7 hours on low.
Chicken thighs have a richer flavor, and can cook for a longer period of time; 8-9 hours is typical.
Whole chickens cook for the longest time period; 8-10 hours is the norm.
Be sure to follow the layering instructions in the recipe; chicken should be placed on top of root vegetables.

name: Slow Cooker Jambalaya
author: Food Network - Robin Miller
ingredients: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
1 pound frozen peeled and cooked shrimp, thawed
instructions: In a slow cooker, combine chicken, sausage, tomatoes, onion, green pepper, celery, and chicken broth.
Stir in oregano, Cajun seasoning, hot sauce, bay leaves, and thyme.
Cover, and cook on LOW for 7 hours or on HIGH for 3 hours.
Stir in the thawed shrimp, cover and cook until the shrimp is heated through, about 5 minutes.
Discard bay leaves and spoon mixture over cooked rice.

name: Slow Cooker Pulled Pork
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: 3 Pounds Pork Shoulder, Trimmed of Fat
instructions: Combine all ingredients except for onion and pork into crock pot. Whisk all ingredients until well blended.
NOTE: If you are in a big rush in the mornings, you can substitute all or some of the spices with a 16 ounce bottle your favorite brand of barbecue sauce and 1/4 cup water.
Place pork and onions into mixture, coating both sides of meat.
Cook for 8 to 10 hours under 'low' slow cooker setting.
After meat is cooked, remove from slow cooker onto plate and break apart with fork.
Place meat back into warm sauce to absorb all the juices and spices, and to reheat.
Serve on your favorite buns, such as Kaiser Rolls or onion rolls.

name: Slow Cooker Southwest Chicken
author: Brian T. Whaley
instructions: In crock pot mix salsa and taco seasoning.
Place chicken in crock pot.
Cook on low 6 hours.
After the 6 hours, use fork to shred chicken in the pot.
Then add the sour cream, salsa con queso, black beans, and corn.
Cook an additional hour.
Serve over rice or in tortillas.

name: Apple Cinnamon Cranberry Sauce
author: Jason Whaley
instructions: Place the cranberries and water to a small saucepan
Bring the water & cranberries to a boil
Boil for 5 minutes
Add in the quartered apples, Splenda, and cinnamon
Boil for another 5 minutes
Remove from heat
Blend the contents in a food processor or blender until thoroughly pureed
Chill and serve

name: Mom's Candied Yams
author: Delores Whaley
instructions: Peel all the yams
Slice all the yams into 1/2 inch slices (do not quarter the yams - leave the slices whole
Par boil the yams so they are not hard and crunchy, but also not soft and mushy
In a separate sauce pan, melt the stick of margarine
Add the brown sugar, melt into the margarine
Layer the yams into a pyrex dish or casserole dish
Cover the yams with the melted margarine and brown sugar
Place the dish into the oven and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour
Do not cover while in the oven
Baste the yams every 15 minutes while cooking
Five minutes before complete, cover the yams in mini marshmallows and place back in the oven

name: Brian's Cucumber Salad
author: Brian T. Whaley
ingredients: Your favorite Italian or Balsamic salad dressing
instructions: Quarter the cucumbers the long way
Dice the cucumbers into bite size pieces
Place the into a large bowl
Dice the onions and place them into the bowl
Cover them in the Italian salad dressing
Mix well, ensuring the cucumbers and onions are covered thoroughly with dressing
Refrigerate, letting them marinate overnight

name: Mom's Macaroni Salad
author: Delores Whaley
instructions: Bring a pot of water to boil. Boild pasta as recommended until cooked. Place in a large bowl.
Dice celery very fine. Add to the bowl.
Dice the onion very fine. Add to the bowl.
Add in the tuna fish to the bowl.
Mix in just enough mayonnaise to cover everything.
Add in a little bit of mustard, salt, pepper, and parsley to taste.
Chill in the refirgerator overnight. Serve cold.

name: Fruit Sorbet
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups squeezed fruit juice (if citrus) or bleded fruit otherwise
1 tablespoon zest (if using a citrus fruit)
instructions: Combine sugar and water in a saucepan.
Heat on medium high heat just to a boil, stirring until the sugar has dissolved.
Remove from heat and add zest.
Cover and let stand for 10 minutes.
Puree the fruit in a blender or food processor.
If using citrus fruit, juice the fruit instead of puree - the membranes are bitter and shold not be used.
Then pour fruit juice through a strainer into a medium sized bowl.
Let cool to room temperature.
If using an ice cream maker, cover and chill for several hours or overnight.
Pour into an ice cream maker and process according to manufacturer directions.
Add in Mint sprigs (optional)
Otherwise, freeze overnight and re-blend with the blender. This makes the sorbet lighter and more consistently flavored.
For a change, Replace the sugar with sweetened condensed milk to make ice cream.

name: Helene's Better Than Sex Cake
author: Helene Borodin
ingredients: 1 chocolate cake mix (This is also good with yellow cake)
(you can substitute 1/2 bag (12 oz) Ghirardelli Milk chocolate chips)
(sometimes you don't need to add the nuts)
instructions: In bowl combine 2 tablespoons cake mix, pecans and chocolate chips. Stir to coat; set aside.
Combine remaining cake mix, eggs, oil, water, sour cream, vanilla and pudding. Mix well with mixer.
Fold in chips and nuts.
Pour into greased and floured Bundt pan.
Bake 350 degrees for 55 minutes until done.
It is a good idea to check on the cake 10 to 15 minutes before the cake is done, as every oven is a little bit different.
Cool 25 minutes and remove from pan.
Frosting:
Melt butter
Add brown sugar. Cook until it bubbles.
Add milk and cook until smooth.
Remove from heat and add sifted powdered sugar.
Whisk until smooth.
Drizzle over the cake.

name: No Bake Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup whey protein isolate (I like chocolate)
1/2 cup chopped nuts (peanuts, cashews, almonds, hazelnuts, sunflower seeds, etc.)
instructions: In large saucepan, combine Splenda, milk, salt, vanilla and mix well.
Bring to a boil for 1 minute.
Put on low heat and stir in peanut butter until smooth.
If using oatmeal, add it and mix well. Do not use regular or instant oatmeal; quick-cooking oatmeal is essential to the success of this recipe.
Remove the saucepan from heat.
Mix in any other ingredients, such as whey, coconut flakes, granola, dried fruit, nuts, graham cracker crumbs, etc.
Let cool until you can touch the mixture; then drop mixture by spoonfuls onto waxed paper or parchment lined baking sheets.
Let cool completely; store at room temperature.
You can also pour this mixture into a 9 inch square pyrex dish, let cool, then cut into squares.
If you want, you can try to line the pyrex dish with whole graham crackers, or with graham cracker crumbs.

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup whey protein isolate (could be unflavored, chocolate, vanilla, etc)
instructions: Chop the oats in a food processor into fine bits
Mix all ingredients
Scoop onto cookie tin, flatten into cookies
Bake 325 degrees for 20 minutes

name: Aunt Edith's Cheesecake
author: Edith Lennetti
instructions: Melt butter
Mix with graham cracker crumbs
Pat in bottom and sides of spring form pan
Beat cream cheese and sour cream until mixed well. Add sugar, vanilla and one egg at a time. Mix well
Pour into spring form pan
Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours
THE SECRET - After 1 1/2 hours, turn the oven off but leave the cheesecake in for another 2 hours. DO NOT OPEN THE OVEN!
Variation - Pumpkin Cheesecake :
Use 1 small can of pumpkin instead of sour cream
Use only 3 cream cheese packages
Use only 3 eggs
Variation - Nutella Cheesecake :
Use Nutella instead of sour cream
Use only 3 cream cheese packages
Use only 3 eggs
Add ground roasted hazelnuts to the crust mix
Pour half of cheesecake mix out onto prepared crust
Add a big dollop of Nutella to the batter still in your mixing bowl.
Beat to combine.
Pour over the rest and swirl to marble.
Halfway through the baking process, sprinkle hazelnuts all around the edges.

name: Grandma's Biscotti
author: Rose Barbano
instructions: Mix dry ingredients well
Mix together eggs, anisette extract, milk and butter
Beat well
Add to dry mix
Roll dough into rolls about 1/2 inch thick
Bake at 350 - 375 degrees until partially done
Take out of oven and cut diagonally
Bake until done or about 20 minutes all together or until light brown

name: Grandma's Fried Twisties
author: Rose Barbano
ingredients: 1 tablespoon sugar to every cup flour
1 orange rind (grated) and juice from orange
1/4 # Oleo (1 bar or a little less)
instructions: Makes 1 1/2 very large wide bowls
Roll out dough on lightly floured board or table
Do not roll out too thin.
Cut dough into rectangles about 3 inches long by 1 inch wide
Cut a slit in the middle of the rectangle about 1 inch long.
Pull the top half through the slit to form a bow-tie.
Fry in hot oil or Crisco until brown.
Remove from oil and put on paper towel to drain and cool.
Sprinkle with confectioners sugar when ready to eat.

name: Grandma's Pizelles
summary: Pizzelle are traditional Italian waffle cookies originally made in the Abruzzo region of south-central Italy. The name comes from the Italian word for 'round and flat' (pizze); this is also the meaning of the word pizza. Many other cultures have developed a pizzelle-type cookie as part of their culture. It is known to be one of the oldest cookies, and is believed to have developed from the ancient Roman crustulum. The cookie dough or batter is put into a pizzelle iron, which resembles a waffle iron. Typically, the iron stamps a snowflake pattern onto both sides of the thin golden-brown cookie, which has a crisp texture once it is cooled. Pizzelle are popular during Christmas and Easter. They are often found at Italian weddings, alongside other traditional pastries such as cannoli and traditional Italian cookies. It is also common for two pizzelle to be sandwiched with cannoli cream or hazelnut spread. Pizzelle, while still warm, can also be rolled using a wodden dowel to create cannoli shells.  More information at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pizzelle
author: Rose Barbano
ingredients: 5 to 6 cups flour (enough to make the batter thick)
instructions: Mix everything but the flour together
Add flour gradually, while using an electric mixer
Mix well
Pour two tablespoons or so on hot pizzelle iron.
Variation - Chocolate Pizzelles
Add:
1/2 cup cocoa
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 tsp. baking powder
Do not include the anisette extract
Follow the rest of the Ingredients and Preparation

name: Mom's Butterball Cookies
author: Delores Whaley
instructions: Melt butter, and wait for it to cool.
Cream Butter, sugar, and egg yolks
Add flour and walnuts, and mix well
Roll into little balls, about the size of a quarter
Place on an ungreased cookie sheet about 1 inch apart
Bake at 325 degrees until golden brown, approximately 20 to 30 minutes
Cool until they can be handled
While still warm, roll each cookie in confectionary sugar

name: Mom's M and M Cookies
author: Delores Whaley
instructions: Blend shortening and sugars
Beat in vanilla and eggs
Sift remaining dry Ingredients together
Add dry Ingredients to the sugar mixture
Mix well
Stir in 1/2 cup M and Ms (reserve remaining M and Ms for decorating)
Drop from teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet
Decorate tops of cookies as desired
Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes until golden brown

name: Valia's Pepper Cookies
author: Valia
ingredients: 1/2 bottle anisette extract (or more if you like)
instructions: Mix all ingredients
Add milk as needed to make a stiff dough
Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes
In a separate bowl, mix confectioners sugar and anisette extract
Add in water carefully as needed. Keep the icing thick.
After cookies are cool to the touch, dip cookies individually upside down into the icing and set aside to harden.
